answers.answer: Growth scans can be off so would not read too much into them. I don't have GD but have large babies.  They never been right about my babies. My first at 35 wks was said to be 9 lbs, and was 7 lbs 12 oz, my second son I forget what he was said to be but was 8 lbs 11 oz, 3 rd son was said to be 8 lbs around 39 wks and was born 6 days late and was 10lbs 2 oz, forth so. Was to be 8 lbs and was born 8 lbs 15.? Oz so 9 lbs.  Sorry not to scare you on big babies not my point just that they can be wrong with the weights.  All my were deliever vaginally and no ripping if that helps.  I hope all goes well for you.  Try not to worry on how they baby will come into the world hard I know but better to deliver a baby into the world than stay pregnant forever right.  I always tell mom all delivery are natural no matter what kid you have as staying pregnant forever is unnatural.

I'm currently in the hospital after being admitted. Started I went in due to dehydration from stomach bug. They monitored the baby and noticed crazy contractions.  Decided to check me and I'm currently 90% thinned and 2 cm dialated.  I will be 32 weeks on Wednesday and I also have gestational diabetes, did a high risk scan this morning and estimated to being 6 lbs even right now. I will definitely keep you in my prayers and hope for a healthy baby and delivery. .
I'm not scared of delivering a big baby but, I'm built very small and have had a ton of complications with this pregnancy. Followed up with my OB and the plan is to deliver via c-section at 37 weeks.

question: Just looking for some reassurance! I just got home from L&D, I am having pretty regular contractions that are fairly painful, cervix is still high and not thinned very much but, dilated 1 1/2 centimeters. I have gestational diabetes and a growth scan tonight, estimated baby to be 7 pounds! This is my second pregnancy and my first child was born at 37 weeks and 7.3 pounds. Just wondering if anyone else on here has experienced something similar. My doctor is VBAC supportive  (c-section on first pregnancy due to preeclampsia) bit I'm worried I may have to deliver early and via c-section again.
title: 33 weeks, 1 cm dilated, BIG baby
